forecast.headline: Perfect Friday, Wild Tuesday - Mixed Week Ahead
forecast.week_summary: Friday delivers perfect conditions with calm winds and 25°C temperatures - ideal for both Cottesloe sunbaking and North Cottesloe snorkelling. Early mornings Wednesday-Monday offer glassy snorkel sessions, but Tuesday's 43km/h gusts make it a write-off. Weekend warriors should hit Leighton Beach Saturday for decent conditions despite the wind.
forecast.water_temp_feel: Perfect - boardies all day, refreshing dips

days.one_liner: Early bird gets the glassy conditions at Leighton, windy by lunch
days.pro_tip: Hit the sheltered northern groynes at City Beach when the wind picks up

days.one_liner: South Beach snorkelling at its finest - perfect visibility and calm seas
days.pro_tip: Low tide at 12:49pm means crystal clear snorkelling conditions all morning

days.one_liner: Dream beach day - light winds and 25°C, Cottesloe will be buzzing
days.pro_tip: Grab breakfast at Cottesloe Surf Club after your morning swim - perfect combo

days.one_liner: Weekend warriors should hit sheltered spots - City Beach groynes your friend
days.pro_tip: Avoid Cottesloe crowds - City Beach playground keeps families happy with same great swimming

days.one_liner: Strong winds but Leighton's shelter scores mean decent beach time
days.pro_tip: Dog beach at South Beach - perfect for four-legged family members when it's gusty

days.one_liner: Back to beauty - 29°C and light winds make it a scorcher
days.pro_tip: High tide at 10:10am means deeper water at North Cottesloe's Peters Pool

days.one_liner: Wild winds and big waves - even Cottesloe only rates 30/100
days.pro_tip: Perfect day for Hillarys Boat Harbour shopping and fish & chips instead

best_snorkel.why: Perfect visibility, calm seas, and low tide crystal clarity

best_beach.why: Dream conditions - 25°C, light winds, perfect for sunset drinks

hidden_gem.why: 29°C scorcher with high tide filling Peters Pool perfectly

alerts: Tuesday 3rd Feb - Dangerous conditions with 44km/h gusts and 1m+ waves
Weekend crowds expected at Cottesloe - consider City Beach alternatives
forecast.fun_fact: Peters Pool at North Cottesloe was formed by a limestone reef that creates a natural lagoon - it's deepest at high tide around 10am Monday, making it perfect for floating and snorkelling!
